okay next one. I am setting up a dual boot sys here and would like some help with the paritioning.
what should the size be of my swap partition? (system ram is 1gb)
try 1 GB, it's completely arbitrary and can be changed at any time if it's at the end of a disk
i wouldn't worry too much about it. just give it a GB
you don't need a boot partition
boot needs enough size to contain your kernel images and your initrd. i really don't think you need one but if you're hellbent on making a boot partition then be my guest.
i.e. 128 MB is ample
if you want to take my advice, have /, /home and swap. you really don't need more than that for most cases and having /home on a separate partition is just convenient for power users
bear in mind that things like UT2004 are about 6 GB
there won't be any games in my laption :) at least not UT
you can, but it is difficult
basically, you can't move the start of an ext3 partition. it's just not possible
so you are limited by that
fat32 will destroy your user permissions, and probably filenames
fat32 can't store filenames with colons, double quotes, or many other chars - but you could of course just move everything to a new ext3 partition :P
